results.title: Sex and Faith Overheat in Jamie Quatro’s ‘Fire Sermon’
results.abstract: Quatro’s first novel, following an acclaimed collection of stories, is about a religious woman in a passionless marriage.

results.title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: ‘Goddess of Anarchy’

results.title: Sue Grafton, Whose Detective Novels Spanned the Alphabet, Dies at 77
results.abstract: Her popular series about a female private eye began in 1982 with “A Is for Alibi” and continued through “Y Is for Yesterday” this year.

multimedia.caption: Sue Grafton in 2002. Her final book in the Kinsey Millhone series of novels, “Y Is for Yesterday,” was published in August. “The alphabet now ends at Y,” her daughter Jamie Clark said.

results.title: We Aren’t Destroying the Earth
results.abstract: In a new book, “Inheritors of the Earth,” Chris Thomas argues that animals and plants are adapting to the world we are creating. We need not worry.
des_facet: Inheritors of the Earth: How Nature Is Thriving in an Age of Extinction (Book)

results.title: The Oil and Gas Sector Is Changing — and So Is Geopolitics

results.title: James Rollins: By the Book
results.abstract: At the beginning of his career, James Rollins, author of ‘The Demon Crown,’ stole Samuel Clemens’s pen name.

results.title: On the Lam With Timothy Leary
results.abstract: “The Most Dangerous Man in America,” by Bill Minutaglio and Steven L. Davis, recounts the LSD advocate’s globe-trotting attempt to outrun Richard Nixon and the American law.
des_facet: The Most Dangerous Man in America: Timothy Leary, Richard Nixon and the Hunt for the Fugitive King of LSD (Book)

results.title: Two Books Consider Earthquakes and Their Human Tolls
results.abstract: In “The Great Quake,” Henry Fountain recounts what we learned from North America’s biggest temblor. In “Quakeland,” Kathryn Miles takes a fault-eye view of the continent.
des_facet: Quakeland: On the Road to America's Next Devastating Earthquake (Book)
The Great Quake: How the Biggest Earthquake in North America Changed Our Understanding of the Planet (Book)

results.title: When Woolly Mammoths Roamed the Earth
results.abstract: Three books examine our fascination with the ancient pachyderms and their extinction.
des_facet: The Ends of the World: Volcanic Apocalypses, Lethal Oceans, and Our Quest to Understand Earth's Past Mass Extinctions (Book)
Woolly: The True Story of the Quest to Revive One of History's Most Iconic Extinct Creatures (Book)
Discovering the Mammoth: A Tale of Giants, Unicorns, Ivory, and the Birth of a New Science (Book)

results.title: New & Noteworthy
results.abstract: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around The Times are reading.

results.title: A Novelist’s Requiem for the Male Libido
results.abstract: The jealous and aging protagonist of Hanif Kureishi’s novel “The Nothing” uses his hearing aid to spy on his young wife and her friend.

results.title: From ‘Frankenstein’ to Nora Roberts in 200 Years
results.abstract: New releases in speculative fiction include a viral dystopia, a fantasy kingdom ruled by magic, a lesbian pulp noir satire and a classic revisited.

results.title: Dear Match Book: Religion in Fiction
results.abstract: From the humorous to the mysterious, dystopian to sorrowful, novels and stories that reveal the wide range of literary theology.

results.title: In a Year of Nonstop News, a Batch of Business Books Worth Reading
results.abstract: Our DealBook columnist picks his favorite business books to dive into as 2017 comes to a close.
des_facet: The Captain Class: The Hidden Force That Creates the World's Greatest Teams (Book)
Wild Ride: Inside Uber's Quest for World Domination (Book)
Reset: My Fight for Inclusion and Lasting Change (Book)
Adaptive Markets: Financial Evolution at the Speed of Thought (Book)
Machine, Platform, Crowd: Harnessing Our Digital Future (Book)
The Spider Network: The Wild Story of a Math Genius, a Gang of Backstabbing Bankers, and One of the Greatest Scams in Financial History (Book)
